column4: can someone please tell me -- how do i get an "aptitude dist-upgrade" to respect my manually removed packages (IE Kopete0
CTRL+ALT+F1-6
if you have manually removed them they won't be upgraded or installed. when you say 'manually' do you mean apt-get remove or dpkg -P or using synaptic?
i did aptitude remove kopete, but now whenever i do a dist-upgrade it wants to install it again (Along with metapackage kubutnu-desktop)
ahah, do this 'dpkg -l | grep kopete'
see anything there?
rc  kopete                                          3.4.2-0ubuntu3                       instant messenger for KDE
hmm, see it wasnt removed. this time do this. 'sudo dpkg -P kopete'
i dont get why an aptitude remove didnt remove it
the -P flag means 'Purge' eg total cleanse.
yes, that does seem strange. regardless, apt and aptitude are advanced, network friendly frontends to dpkg, the real package manager in debian systems.
look! it's still there when i try to do a dist-upgrade: The following NEW packages will be installed: adept debtags kdebluetooth kdenetwork kopete kubuntu-desktop lib32gcj6...
im not TOO much of a newbie :)
something else is relying on kopete.
only thing that's relying on kopete are metapackages kubuntu-desktop
kopete is a dependency of another package.. i would say it's kubuntu-desktop
are you using KDE?
kubuntu-desktop and kdenetwork are both metapackages
well dependencies are dependencies.. not much you can do about that without getting into some less useful territory.
personally i don't dist-upgrade, but i wouldn't advise Ubuntu users to do the same.
i use debian primarily, it's a habit i picked up..
AFAIK he wants to do this to his entire partition.
precis
